revised_title: Investigations on the Deviation of Magnetized Needles due to Iron Influence
tldr: The author, Samuel Hunter Christie, conducted experiments to study the deviation of magnetized needles due to the influence of iron. He found that the length of the needle significantly affects its deviation, and the efficacy of a small mass of iron as a compensation for more distant masses depends on its distance from the needle. The author also proposed equations to determine the deviations of a horizontal needle due to the action of an iron sphere or shell, and his hypothesis is consistent with all the experiments made.
